summary:
Galicia is an autonomous region in northwest Spain, known for its historic nationality status. It borders Portugal and the Atlantic Ocean and is made up of four provinces: A Coru√±a, Lugo, Ourense, and Pontevedra. With a population of over 2.7 million (as of 2018), it boasts a diverse landscape of hills, mountains, and stunning coastlines.

Once ruled by the Roman Empire and later by various kingdoms, Galicia gained self-governance after Spain's democratic restoration. Its economy traditionally relied on agriculture and fishing, but it has since industrialized. Galicia is unique for its two official languages: Galician and Spanish.
title: Galicia (Spain)
